title: German Zwiebelkuchen (Onion Pie) Recipe
description: Zwiebelkuchen is a German onion pie with a creamy filling that's packed with golden caramelized onions and bacon for a deliciously savory treat.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German German Zwiebelkuchen (Onion Pie) 4.7 (66) 55 Reviews 11 Photos Zwiebelkuchen is a delicious onion pie from south-central Germany. Fall is a very special time of year here, as local winemakers will open a BasinWirtschaft in their barn or garage. They serve new wine, fresh zwiebelkuchen, and perhaps some wurst, for a minimal fee! Submitted by Bill Whitford Updated on August 20, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 11 11 11 11 Prep Time: 1 hr Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 2 hrs Servings: 12 Yield: 1 (15x10-inch) pie Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 6 pounds onions, sliced 4 slices bacon 1 (16 ounce) container sour cream 4 large eggs 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour ½ teaspoon salt ½ teaspoon caraway seed 1 (14.1 ounce) package pastry for a double crust pie Directions Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a 15x10-inch pan or large pizza pan with prepared dough, making sure dough extends up sides of pan. Sauté onion in a skillet until translucent and pour cooked onion into a large mixing bowl. Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown. Drain, chop and add to onion; mix well. Stir in sour cream. Beat eggs enough to break up yolks, then mix in to pie mixture. Add flour to thicken mixture (onions will create a lot of water), then add salt. Mix well and pour mixture into prepared pan. Sprinkle top with caraway seed. Bake in preheated oven until onions start to turn golden brown on top, about 1 hour. I Made It Print 96 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 441 Calories 26g Fat 43g Carbs 10g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 441 % Daily Value * Total Fat 26g 34% Saturated Fat 10g 52% Cholesterol 93mg 31% Sodium 415mg 18% Total Carbohydrate 43g 16% Dietary Fiber 5g 17% Total Sugars 12g Protein 10g 21% Vitamin C 13mg 15% Calcium 117mg 9% Iron 2mg 11% Potassium 540mg 11% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Add Your Photo Photos of German Zwiebelkuchen (Onion Pie) 01 of 11 Photo by  CindyR 02 of 11 Photo by  Karen Miller 05/14/2019 03 of 11 Photo by  Mindy Sullivan Stowell 10/23/2017 04 of 11 Photo by  CindyR 10/21/2017 This is a great basic recipe but I did make a few changes. First, I made a yeast dough because it's more traditional. Also, I used a 10" spring form pan and cut the recipe in half. Also, more than 1/2 tsp. of salt is needed. 05 of 11 Photo by  Wags 07/18/2017 I followed recipe exactly minus caraway seed. 06 of 11 Photo by  MMMICHELLE 09/27/2015 Supremely delicious!!! I loved this recipe; savory and satisfying with a wonderful flavor blend. I caramelized my onions and substituted Greek yogurt for the sour cream. I only used 2 pounds of onions, which was plenty for my taste. 07 of 11 Photo by  Mike Moore 01/03/2015 08 of 11 Photo by  Regina Hoelzer 10/03/2014 Wasn't sure how to put pie crust in pan, kind of lined it. Other than that it was ok. Tasted good, 09 of 11 Photo by  FoodArtist 03/09/2011 10 of 11 Photo by  witchywoman 05/20/2010 I didn't know what to expect with this recipe but holy cow! Delicious and different...I'll make this again and again! 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Bierocks (German Meat Turnovers) 176 Ratings Tarte aux Moutarde (French Tomato and Mustard Pie) 55 Ratings Tarte Flambé (Alsatian Bacon and Onion Tart) 7 Ratings Chef John's Tomato Tart 49 Ratings Tomato Pie 346 Ratings Steak and Irish Stout Pie 64 Ratings Vegetable Shepherd's Pie with Baked Beans 5 Ratings Fried Empanadas 194 Ratings Beef and Biscuit 434 Ratings Clam Chowder Tart 2 Ratings Perogies 118 Ratings Bierrocks I 28 Ratings Cowboy Pie 18 Ratings Cajun Oyster Pie 9 Ratings Torta Rustica 70 Ratings Steak and Potato Pie 18 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Bill Whitford
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a 15x10-inch pan or large pizza pan with prepared dough, making sure dough extends up sides of pan.;Sauté onion in a skillet until translucent and pour cooked onion into a large mixing bowl. Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown. Drain, chop and add to onion; mix well.;Stir in sour cream. Beat eggs enough to break up yolks, then mix in to pie mixture. Add flour to thicken mixture (onions will create a lot of water), then add salt. Mix well and pour mixture into prepared pan. Sprinkle top with caraway seed.;Bake in preheated oven until onions start to turn golden brown on top, about 1 hour.
